alert.note: Alert for Steuben (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 4:05PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT STEUBEN COUNTY THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 405 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Canisteo, or 9 miles southeast of Hornell, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Hornell, Bath, Urbana, Canisteo, Wayland, Woodhull, Howard, Jasper, Thurston, and Troupsburg. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 between 34 North and 40. Interstate 390 between 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
